author: Anand Kanwar

review: This is an excellent product that is worth the $39 it costs. There is one big problem with it, however, that makes it almost a 5 and not a 5. The problem is that Amazon's services are treated as a first class citizen on the device, but to play content from a competing service such as Netflix requires locating an app in a menu that is not well organized and then selecting it. It would be better if they could have some mechanism for either manually organizing apps by type or by allowing all content from all services that the customer is subscribed to appear in the various categories. That is, I'd like to see Netflix and Hulu programs intermixed with Amazon programs. I really don't care where my content comes from as long as I can play it.As for the positives, the remote is nice. Being able to control the device from the phone is nice. It can play a wide range of content and even some games. All in all, I'd recommend it, but hope that Amazon can fix the UX.
